libgit2 takes 10+ minutes to clone the local bare llvm repository, command line git:
```$ time git clone --bare llvm-project.git llvm-project-clone
Cloning into bare repository 'llvm-project-clone'...
done.

real    0m0.015s
user    0m0.001s
sys     0m0.014s```

```% sha256sum */lib/libLLVM-11.0.1jl.so
d8cc15875296f1497cdf4dbafb7ce48cc9e2abbfc9871453ef5d48ff2fb9ba3f  LLVM_full.v11.0.1.x86_64-linux-gnu-cxx11/lib/libLLVM-11.0.1jl.so
d8cc15875296f1497cdf4dbafb7ce48cc9e2abbfc9871453ef5d48ff2fb9ba3f  x86_64-linux-gnu-cxx11/lib/libLLVM-11.0.1jl.so```

requirements of a package, according to the README:

> googletest testing framework (to build tests and example programs, optional)
it goes without saying that it's very much not optional and goolgetest is unconditionally needed for building tests that you can't disable without patching the CMake file

master
reference for GitHub branch instead of
main
, which is a relatively recent change in GitHub

messages.text:
Hi folks! I'm trying to bootstrap BinaryBuilder's RootFS from (Intel) macOS and I'm running into some issues (not sure if this is even supported officially). 

First of all, I'm getting errors when extracting the `base` artifact, which seem to be related to the use of bsdtar on MacOS. I was able to work around these by installing gnutar and using that instead. Since BB's archive extraction step isn't specific to the bootstrap process, I wanted to ask if this is a known issue

Secondly, I'm trying to build for the experimental platforms (on master) and I run into a "Tree Hash Mismatch" when downloading `PlatformSupport-aarch64-apple-darwin20.v2021.1.28.x86_64-linux-musl.unpacked` Is this expected for the moment?

elements.text:
Hi folks! I'm trying to bootstrap BinaryBuilder's RootFS from (Intel) macOS and I'm running into some issues (not sure if this is even supported officially). 

First of all, I'm getting errors when extracting the
base

artifact, which seem to be related to the use of bsdtar on MacOS. I was able to work around these by installing gnutar and using that instead. Since BB's archive extraction step isn't specific to the bootstrap process, I wanted to ask if this is a known issue

Secondly, I'm trying to build for the experimental platforms (on master) and I run into a "Tree Hash Mismatch" when downloading
PlatformSupport-aarch64-apple-darwin20.v2021.1.28.x86_64-linux-musl.unpacked
Is this expected for the moment?

messages.text:
Is there a way I can run BB@0.3.0 locally

Whenever I add it to my local repl with Julia 1.6.0-rc1 it throws version incompatibility; as project.toml has set `julia = 1.6` instead of `~1.6.0-0` .

Current problem is- I can't do
```platforms = filter(p -> (Sys.islinux(p)), supported_platforms())
    
platforms = expand_cxxstring_abis(platforms)
platforms = filter(p -> (compiler_abi(p) == CompilerABI(cxxstring_abi=:cxx03)), platforms)
```
as `compiler_abi` is not defined in the latest version unlike in the v2.6.4 (according the logs of the checks).

messages.text: I have a problem: the Yggdrasil build of Cbc_jll uses a [patch](<https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/blob/master/C/Coin-OR/Cbc/bundled/patches/no_lp.patch>) that  I would like to get rid of (I think it's just there for historical reasons. We should work-around the issue in Cbc.jl, rather than upstream. The difference causes unexpected issues: <https://github.com/jump-dev/Cbc.jl/issues/154>). However, I want to keep with the upstream version number of v2.10.5. Do we have a way of disambiguating the "Yggdrasil" version from the "upstream" version?

elements.text: I have a problem: the Yggdrasil build of Cbc_jll uses a [patch](
) that  I would like to get rid of (I think it's just there for historical reasons. We should work-around the issue in Cbc.jl, rather than upstream. The difference causes unexpected issues:
). However, I want to keep with the upstream version number of v2.10.5. Do we have a way of disambiguating the "Yggdrasil" version from the "upstream" version?

Is there anything that has changed in julia 1.5.4 about loading binaries? I'm suddenly getting this error on github-actions:
```libGL error: MESA-LOADER: failed to open swrast (search paths /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri:\$${ORIGIN}/dri:/usr/lib/dri)
libGL error: failed to load driver: swrast```
Nightly works fine

What should I do?
```(@v1.6) pkg> add BinaryBuilder
    Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/General`
    Updating git-repo `<https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General.git>`
   Resolving package versions...
ERROR: Unsatisfiable requirements detected for package BinaryBuilder [12aac903]:
 BinaryBuilder [12aac903] log:
 ├─possible versions are: 0.1.0-0.2.6 or uninstalled
 ├─restricted to versions * by an explicit requirement, leaving only versions 0.1.0-0.2.6
 └─restricted by julia compatibility requirements to versions: uninstalled — no versions left```

messages.text: I know next to nothing about C++ compilation so this might be a stupid question. If my compilation produces `foo`, and `libfoo.a` do I need to make `libfoo.a` a product to wrap? I can't select it in the wizard if so.
